alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 9:18AM CST until January 28 at 8:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bogue Falaya River At Boston St in Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Bogue Falaya...including Boston St in Covington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bogue Falaya River at Boston St in Covington. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Bogue Falaya River Park will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon and continue falling to 3.7 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 03/27/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM CST.
